channel.title: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?
channel.description:
Sorry, I'm REALLY bad at port forwarding as I'm not good with routers, but if you give me some info I can understand what you say *lol*
I'm on my laptop with just a wifi connection to my router. I have access to my router through the whole putting 192.168.1.1 into my browser and searching it there.
Using a Windows 7 Laptop with Cisco E900 router. Here's the IP Page: [IMG]http://i47.tinypic.com/1043uqv.png[/img]
Here's my current port forward page..but I don't know if I did it right -.- [IMG]http://i48.tinypic.com/14o4049.png[/img]

item.title: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @ultimatepkvillage ultimatepkvillage
item.description:
@ultimatepkvillage wrote:

improvisation:

I made an entry for both TCP and UDP. Now how will I add exceptions to the firwall? can’t find where to do that…

try putting the protocol on both instead

Start button
control panel
system and security
windows firewall
advanced settings
inbound rules
new rule

Read full topic
item.source: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?

item.title: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

[quote=“runescape sucks, post:8, topic:451405”]You could disable the firewall completely, but i wouldn’t recommend it[/quote]windows firewall is horrible. Get a real firewall, go buy a watchguard.

Read full topic

@marcbob wrote:

runescape sucks:

You could disable the firewall completely, but i wouldn’t recommend it

I do that just because it doesn’t block any users from connecting. Never gets me viruses or anything.

item.title: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

start - control panel - security - windows firewall

go to exceptions tab , add ports 43594 or whatever port your using for your rsps for tcp and then do it again for udp

Read full topic

item.title: Can someone give me individualized help on Port Forwarding?
item.dc:creator: @Loveandpower Loveandpower
item.description:
@Loveandpower wrote:

make sure to make an entry for tcp AND udp both.

make sure you are adding the exceptions into the firewall.
